stages.logText: I found two not very bright brothers in a cellar of their house. They seemed to be talking about some sinister plan.
They were planning to destroy the great dam of Brimhaven. They just could not agree how they would do it.
They asked me to help them.
I have agreed to destroy the dam for them.
The brothers gave me a hand axe that could weaken the dam in a vulnerable place.
I took another hand axe. This time I shouldn't lose it.
I found the weak spot in the dam and started hacking at the wood.
Water came pouring through the hole in the dam. A lot of water!
I refused to destroy the dam for the brothers.
Given what I overheard, I was not allowed to leave. The two brothers attacked me.
Someone else destroyed the dam and water came pouring through a hole in the dam. A lot of water!
The Brimhaven guards have informed me that I may not leave the town until they have investigated who destroyed the dam.
I have promised to track down the real perpetrators. However, I still cannot leave the town.
The two brothers did not know their boss's name, but he seemed to have a lot of gold.
The rich man living up on the hill of Brimhaven seemed to know more than he admitted.
The rich man boasted that he had been bribed by an important man in Loneford to sabotage the dam.
I gave the letters as a piece of evidence to the captain of the guard. Now it is up to them to deal with the rich man.
